text: I'll post an issue if this is indeed not expected, just didn't want to spam if this is just a misunderstanding on my end

elements.text: I'll post an issue if this is indeed not expected, just didn't want to spam if this is just a misunderstanding on my end

text:
example to illustrate the issue:
```julia> Int
Int64

julia> using LinearAlgebra

julia> LinearAlgebra.BlasInt
Int32

julia> v = rand(typemax(Int32) + 2);

julia> norm(v);
ERROR: InexactError: trunc(Int32, 2147483649)
Stacktrace:
 [1] throw_inexacterror(::Symbol, ::Type{Int32}, ::Int64) at ./boot.jl:558
 [2] checked_trunc_sint at ./boot.jl:580 [inlined]
 [3] toInt32 at ./boot.jl:617 [inlined]
 [4] Int32 at ./boot.jl:707 [inlined]
 [5] convert at ./number.jl:7 [inlined]
 [6] RefValue at ./refvalue.jl:8 [inlined]
 [7] convert at ./refpointer.jl:63 [inlined]
 [8] cconvert at ./essentials.jl:388 [inlined]
 [9] nrm2 at /buildworker/worker/package_linuxaarch64/build/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.5/LinearAlgebra/src/blas.jl:413 [inlined]
 [10] nrm2 at /buildworker/worker/package_linuxaarch64/build/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.5/LinearAlgebra/src/blas.jl:419 [inlined]
 [11] norm2(::Array{Float64,1}) at /buildworker/worker/package_linuxaarch64/build/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.5/LinearAlgebra/src/dense.jl:105
 [12] norm(::Array{Float64,1}, ::Int64) at /buildworker/worker/package_linuxaarch64/build/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.5/LinearAlgebra/src/generic.jl:607
 [13] norm(::Array{Float64,1}) at /buildworker/worker/package_linuxaarch64/build/usr/share/julia/stdlib/v1.5/LinearAlgebra/src/generic.jl:605
 [14] top-level scope at REPL[5]:1```
